tutorial.title: How to Use the ARIA Playground

step1.title: Write Your HTML Code
step1.description: Use the code editor on the left to write or paste your HTML. The editor provides autocomplete for ARIA attributes and validates your code in real-time. Press Ctrl+Enter to run your code.

step2.title: See the Live Preview
step2.description: The preview panel shows your code rendered as it would appear in a browser. You can interact with elements by clicking or using keyboard navigation (Tab, Enter, arrows).

step3.title: Monitor Screen Reader Output
step3.description: The bottom panel shows what a screen reader would announce as you interact with elements. Select different screen reader modes (NVDA, VoiceOver, JAWS) to see how announcements differ.

step4.title: Explore ARIA Attributes
step4.description: Click the settings icon to access the ARIA Explorer sidebar, which provides a searchable reference of all ARIA roles, states, and properties with examples you can insert directly into your code.

tips.title: üí° Pro Tips
tips.tip1: Use the ARIA Explorer to discover available attributes and see example usage
tips.tip2: Enable audio output to hear how screen readers would speak the content
tips.tip3: Test keyboard navigation by using Tab to move through interactive elements
tips.tip4: Share your code with others using the Share button to get a shareable URL
